exercises.name: Jumping Jacks
exercises.description: Classic cardio warm-up that elevates heart rate and warms the whole body
instructions: Stand tall with feet together, arms at your sides
Jump your feet out wide while raising arms overhead
Your body should form a star shape at the top
Jump feet back together while lowering arms
Keep a steady rhythm throughout
Land softly on the balls of your feet

modifications.easier: Step side to side instead of jumping (step jacks)
modifications.harder: Add a squat between each jack

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squat
exercises.description: Fundamental lower body movement that builds leg strength and improves mobility
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out
Brace your core and keep your chest lifted
Push your hips back as if sitting into a chair
Bend your knees and lower until thighs are parallel to floor
Keep your weight in your heels, knees tracking over toes
Drive through your heels to stand back up
Squeeze your glutes at the top

modifications.easier: Squat to a chair or reduce depth
modifications.harder: Add a pause at the bottom or pulse

exercises.name: Push-Up
exercises.description: Upper body pushing strength for chest, shoulders and triceps
instructions: Start in a plank position, hands slightly wider than shoulders
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels
Engage your core — don't let your hips sag or pike up
Lower your chest towards the floor by bending your elbows
Go down until your chest nearly touches the ground
Push through your palms to return to the start
Keep your elbows at about 45 degrees from your body

modifications.easier: Knees on floor, or push against a wall or elevated surface
modifications.harder: Elevate feet, or add a clap between reps

exercises.name: Reverse Lunge
exercises.description: Single-leg strength and balance that's gentler on the knees than forward lunges
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Step one foot back about 2-3 feet
Lower your body until both knees are at 90 degrees
Keep your front knee directly over your ankle
Your back knee should hover just above the floor
Push through your front heel to return to standing
Keep your torso upright throughout the movement

modifications.easier: Hold onto a wall for balance, reduce range of motion
modifications.harder: Add a jump to switch legs in the air

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.description: Core stability and endurance — the foundation of a strong midsection
instructions: Place your forearms on the floor, elbows under shoulders
Extend your legs back, balancing on your toes
Create a straight line from your head to your heels
Engage your core by pulling your belly button to spine
Don't let your hips sag down or pike up
Keep your neck neutral, looking at the floor
Breathe steadily — don't hold your breath

modifications.easier: Drop to your knees, or hold for shorter time
modifications.harder: Lift one arm or leg, or add shoulder taps

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
exercises.description: High-intensity cardio and core combo that builds endurance
instructions: Start in a push-up position, hands under shoulders
Keep your core tight and body in a straight line
Drive one knee towards your chest
Quickly switch legs, driving the other knee forward
Keep your hips low — don't let them pike up
Move as fast as you can while maintaining form
Keep your hands firmly planted throughout

modifications.easier: Slow the pace down, or step instead of jump
modifications.harder: Cross knee to opposite elbow for oblique twist

exercises.name: Glute Bridge
exercises.description: Glute activation and hip mobility — great for desk workers
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on floor
Place feet hip-width apart, about a foot from your bum
Arms rest by your sides, palms down
Push through your heels to lift your hips off the floor
Squeeze your glutes hard at the top
Create a straight line from shoulders to knees
Lower with control and repeat

modifications.harder: Single leg bridge, or add a 3-second hold at top

exercises.name: Dead Bug
exercises.description: Core stability with controlled movement — protects the lower back
instructions: Lie on your back with arms reaching to the ceiling
Lift your legs so knees are bent at 90 degrees
Press your lower back firmly into the floor
Slowly lower your right arm and left leg towards the floor
Only go as low as you can while keeping back flat
Return to start and repeat on the opposite side
Move slowly — control is more important than speed

modifications.easier: Move only your legs, keep arms still
modifications.harder: Slow down to 5 seconds per rep, or add ankle weights

exercises.name: Bird Dog
exercises.description: Core stability and back health — part of the McGill Big 3
instructions: Start on hands and knees, wrists under shoulders, knees under hips
Keep your back flat like a table top
Brace your core as if someone might push you
Slowly extend your right arm forward and left leg back
Reach until arm and leg are parallel to the floor
Keep your hips level — don't let them rotate
Hold briefly, then return with control and switch sides

modifications.easier: Extend only the arm OR only the leg
modifications.harder: Add a pause at full extension, or draw circles with limbs

exercises.name: Wall Sit
exercises.description: Isometric leg strength and endurance — great for runners
instructions: Stand with your back against a wall
Walk your feet out about 2 feet from the wall
Slide down until your thighs are parallel to the floor
Keep your knees at 90 degrees, directly over ankles
Press your lower back into the wall
Hold this position — your thighs will burn!
Breathe steadily throughout

modifications.easier: Don't go as deep, or hold for shorter time
modifications.harder: Single leg variation, or hold a weight

exercises.name: Burpee
exercises.description: Full-body high-intensity movement — the ultimate conditioning exercise
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down and place your hands on the floor
Jump or step your feet back to a plank position
Perform a push-up (optional for easier version)
Jump or step feet forward to your hands
Explode up into a jump with arms overhead
Land softly and immediately go into the next rep

modifications.easier: Step back instead of jump, skip the push-up, step up instead of jump
modifications.harder: Add a tuck jump at the top

exercises.name: Superman
exercises.description: Back extension for a strong posterior chain
instructions: Lie face down with arms extended overhead
Keep your legs straight, toes pointed
Engage your glutes and back muscles
Simultaneously lift arms, chest and legs off the floor
Imagine reaching forward with your fingers and back with your toes
Hold briefly at the top, squeezing your back
Lower with control and repeat

modifications.easier: Lift only arms OR only legs
modifications.harder: Hold at top for 3-5 seconds each rep

exercises.name: High Knees
exercises.description: Cardio and hip flexor engagement — great warm-up or cardio burst
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Run in place, driving knees up towards your chest
Aim to get knees to hip height or higher
Pump your arms in a running motion
Stay on the balls of your feet
Keep your core engaged and posture tall
Maintain a quick tempo

modifications.easier: March instead of run, lower knee height
modifications.harder: Increase speed, or add arm drivers overhead

exercises.name: Tricep Dip
exercises.description: Upper body pushing movement focused on the triceps
instructions: Sit on edge of a sturdy chair, bench or step
Place hands on edge, fingers pointing forward
Slide your bum off the edge, supporting weight on hands
Keep feet flat on floor, knees bent at 90 degrees
Lower your body by bending elbows to 90 degrees
Keep your back close to the chair as you lower
Push through your palms to return to start

modifications.easier: Keep feet closer, bend knees more to reduce load
modifications.harder: Extend legs straight, or elevate feet on another surface

exercises.name: Side Plank
instructions: Lie on your side with elbow directly under shoulder
Stack your feet on top of each other
Lift your hips so body forms a straight line
Keep your core tight and hips lifted
Top arm can reach to ceiling or rest on hip
Hold position while breathing steadily
Lower with control, then switch sides

modifications.easier: Bottom knee on floor for support
modifications.harder: Lift top leg, or add hip dips up and down
